dn14:3.30.2.eng: ‘In the present fortunate eon, good fellow, you have arisen in the world, perfected and fully awakened.

dn14:3.30.3.pli: Bhagavā, mārisā, khattiyo jātiyā khattiyakule uppanno.
dn14:3.30.3.eng: You were born as an aristocrat into an aristocrat family.

dn14:3.30.5.pli: Bhagavato, mārisā, appakaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ parittaṃ lahukaṃ yo ciraṃ jīvati, so vassasataṃ appaṃ vā bhiyyo.
dn14:3.30.5.eng: For you the life-span is short, brief, and fleeting. A long life is a hundred years or a little more.

dn14:3.30.6.eng: You were awakened at the root of a peepal tree.

dn14:3.30.7.pli: Bhagavato, mārisā, sāriputtamoggallānaṃ nāma sāvakayugaṃ ahosi aggaṃ bhaddayugaṃ.
dn14:3.30.7.eng: You have a fine pair of chief disciples named Sāriputta and Moggallāna.

dn14:3.30.8.pli: Bhagavato, mārisā, eko sāvakānaṃ sannipāto ahosi aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhusatāni. Bhagavato, mārisā, ayaṃ eko sāvakānaṃ sannipāto ahosi sabbesaṃyeva khīṇāsavānaṃ.
dn14:3.30.8.eng: You have had one gathering of disciples—1,250 mendicants who had ended their defilements.

dn14:3.30.9.pli: Bhagavato, mārisā, ānando nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
dn14:3.30.9.eng: You have as chief attendant a mendicant named Ānanda.

dn14:3.30.10.pli: Bhagavato, mārisā, suddhodano nāma rājā pitā ahosi.

dn14:3.30.11.pli: Māyā nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
dn14:3.30.11.eng: your birth mother was Queen Māyā,

dn14:3.30.12.eng: and your capital city was Kapilavatthu.

dn14:3.30.13.pli: Bhagavato, mārisā, evaṃ abhinikkhamanaṃ ahosi evaṃ pabbajjā evaṃ padhānaṃ evaṃ abhisambodhi evaṃ dhammacakkappavattanaṃ.
dn14:3.30.13.eng: And such was your renunciation, such your going forth, such your striving, such your awakening, and such your rolling forth of the wheel of Dhamma.

dn14:3.30.14.pli: Te mayaṃ, mārisā, bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṃ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti.
dn14:3.30.14.eng: And good fellow, after leading the spiritual life under you we lost our desire for sensual pleasures and were reborn here.’

dn14:3.31.1.pli: Atha khvāhaṃ, bhikkhave, avihehi devehi saddhiṃ yena atappā devā tenupasaṅkamiṃ …pe…
dn14:3.31.1.eng: Then together with the gods of Aviha I went to see the gods of Atappa …

dn14:3.31.2.pli: atha khvāhaṃ, bhikkhave, avihehi ca devehi atappehi ca devehi saddhiṃ yena sudassā devā tenupasaṅkamiṃ.

dn14:3.31.3.pli: Atha khvāhaṃ, bhikkhave, avihehi ca devehi atappehi ca devehi sudassehi ca devehi saddhiṃ yena sudassī devā tenupasaṅkamiṃ. Atha khvāhaṃ, bhikkhave, avihehi ca devehi atappehi ca devehi sudassehi ca devehi sudassīhi ca devehi saddhiṃ yena akaniṭṭhā devā tenupasaṅkamiṃ. Tasmiṃ, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā maṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṃ etadavocuṃ:
dn14:3.31.3.eng: and the fair seeing gods. Then together with all these gods I went to see the gods of Akaniṭṭha, where we had a similar conversation.

dn14:3.31.4.pli: ‘ito so, mārisā, ekanavutikappe yaṃ vipassī bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.

dn14:3.31.5.pli: Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosi.

dn14:3.31.7.pli: Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho koṇḍañño gottena ahosi.

dn14:3.31.8.pli: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asītivassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṃ ahosi.

dn14:3.31.9.pli: Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho pāṭaliyā mūle abhisambuddho.

dn14:3.31.10.pli: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa khaṇḍatissaṃ nāma sāvakayugaṃ ahosi aggaṃ bhaddayugaṃ.

dn14:3.31.11.pli: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānaṃ sannipātā ahesuṃ.

dn14:3.31.15.pli: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānaṃ sannipātā ahesuṃ sabbesaṃyeva khīṇāsavānaṃ.

dn14:3.31.16.pli: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asoko nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.

dn14:3.31.17.pli: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa bandhumā nāma rājā pitā ahosi bandhumatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.

dn14:3.31.18.pli: Bandhumassa rañño bandhumatī nāma nagaraṃ rājadhānī ahosi.

dn14:3.31.19.pli: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa evaṃ abhinikkhamanaṃ ahosi evaṃ pabbajjā evaṃ padhānaṃ evaṃ abhisambodhi, evaṃ dhammacakkappavattanaṃ.

dn14:3.31.20.pli: Te mayaṃ, mārisā, vipassimhi bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṃ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti.

dn14:3.31.21.pli: Tasmiṃyeva kho, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṃ etadavocuṃ:

dn14:3.31.22.pli: ‘ito so, mārisā, ekatiṃse kappe yaṃ sikhī bhagavā …pe…

dn14:3.31.23.pli: te mayaṃ, mārisā, sikhimhi bhagavati tasmiññeva kho, mārisā, ekatiṃse kappe yaṃ vessabhū bhagavā …pe…

dn14:3.31.25.pli: imasmiṃyeva kho, mārisā, bhaddakappe kakusandho koṇāgamano kassapo bhagavā …pe…

dn14:3.31.26.pli: te mayaṃ, mārisā, kakusandhamhi koṇāgamanamhi kassapamhi bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṃ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti.

dn14:3.32.1.pli: Tasmiṃyeva kho, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṃ etadavocuṃ:

dn14:3.32.2.pli: ‘imasmiṃyeva kho, mārisā, bhaddakappe bhagavā etarahi arahaṃ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno.

dn14:3.32.3.pli: Bhagavā, mārisā, khattiyo jātiyā, khattiyakule uppanno.

dn14:3.32.5.pli: Bhagavato, mārisā, appakaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ parittaṃ lahukaṃ yo ciraṃ jīvati, so vassasataṃ appaṃ vā bhiyyo.

dn14:3.32.7.pli: Bhagavato, mārisā, sāriputtamoggallānaṃ nāma sāvakayugaṃ ahosi aggaṃ bhaddayugaṃ.

dn14:3.32.8.pli: Bhagavato, mārisā, eko sāvakānaṃ sannipāto ahosi aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhusatāni.

dn14:3.32.9.pli: Bhagavato, mārisā, ayaṃ eko sāvakānaṃ sannipāto ahosi sabbesaṃyeva khīṇāsavānaṃ.

dn14:3.32.10.pli: Bhagavato, mārisā, ānando nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko aggupaṭṭhāko ahosi.

dn14:3.32.11.pli: Bhagavato, mārisā, suddhodano nāma rājā pitā ahosi.

dn14:3.32.12.pli: Māyā nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.

dn14:3.32.14.pli: Bhagavato, mārisā, evaṃ abhinikkhamanaṃ ahosi, evaṃ pabbajjā, evaṃ padhānaṃ, evaṃ abhisambodhi, evaṃ dhammacakkappavattanaṃ.

dn14:3.32.15.pli: Te mayaṃ, mārisā, bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṃ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti.

dn14:3.33.1.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, tathāgatassevesā dhammadhātu suppaṭividdhā, yassā dhammadhātuyā suppaṭividdhattā tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati, nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati ‘evaṃjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṃ’ itipi.
dn14:3.33.1.eng: And that is how the Realized One is able to recollect the birth, names, clans, lifespan, chief disciples, and gatherings of disciples of the Buddhas of the past who have become fully quenched, cut off proliferation, cut off the course, finished off the cycle, and passed beyond all suffering. It is both because I have clearly comprehended the principle of the teachings,

dn14:3.33.2.pli: ‘Evaṃnāmā evaṅgottā evaṃsīlā evaṃdhammā evaṃpaññā evaṃvihārī evaṃvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṃ’ itipīti.

dn14:3.33.3.pli: Devatāpi tathāgatassa etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ, yena tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati, nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati ‘evaṃjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṃ’ itipi.
dn14:3.33.3.eng: and also because the deities told me.”
dn14:3.33.3.comm: This is the detailed answer to the question asked by the mendicants at DN 14:1.13.6.

dn14:3.33.4.pli: ‘Evaṃnāmā evaṅgottā evaṃsīlā evaṃdhammā evaṃpaññā evaṃvihārī evaṃvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṃ’ itipī”ti.

dn14:3.33.5.eng: That is what the Buddha said.

dn14:3.33.6.pli: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandunti.
dn14:3.33.6.eng: Satisfied, the mendicants approved what the Buddha said.
